organization.title: Kansas Data Access and Support Center
organization.name: kgs-ku-edu

name: ogallala-bedrock-data-enhancement
notes: This data set provides an enhanced estimate of the bedrock elevation of the Ogallala Aquifer in Kansas based on lithologic logs from a variety of sources. The data consists of 50 foot interval contour lines representing the Ogallala bedrock elevation and a point theme representing the well locations where lithologic logs were used to define and contour bedrock elevations. The interpolated contour lines started with the 1995 U.S. Geological Survey estimates of the base of the High Plains Aquifer. Additional lithologic information from well records in the Water Well Completion Records (WWC5), Kansas County Geologic Bulletins, and the WIZARD databases were used to further define bedrock elevations across Ogallala Aquifer Region in Kansas. Bedrock estimates in south west Kansas were further supplemented with additional logs from KGS geophysical records and test holes obtained from the Henkle Drilling Company as part of work associated with the Southwest Kansas Groundwater Management District #3. This data set was updated (December 21, 2004) based on geologic investigation of what had been mapped as two fault zones, the Crooked Creek-Fowler and the Bear Creek, in southwest Kansas. Based on mapping of the elevation of the Blaine Formation top, it was determined that faulting, if present, is not continuous along their mapped extents in the 1995 USGS map. Rather, the structure appears to have resulted from evaporite dissolution and subsidence of the overlying units. The new isolines representing the bedrock surface of the Ogallala Aquifer removes these geologic structures.
